facts: Stamford is widely regarded as one of the finest stone towns in England.
Stamford was used as Meryton in the 2005 Pride & Prejudice film and has also appeared in Middlemarch, The Da Vinci Code and the Golden Bowl.
In 2013, Stamford was rated the best place to live by the Sunday Times.
Stamford has been hosting an annual fair since the Middle Ages. Stamford fair is mentioned in Shakespeare's Henry IV part 2 (act 3 scene 2).
The town has more than 600 listed buildings - more than half the total for the whole county.
